intro: Restio rudolfii, commonly known as the Rudolf's restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial, grass-like plant that typically grows in coastal areas and fynbos vegetation. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
